name: Vegetable Pulao
description: A fragrant rice dish cooked with mixed vegetables and whole spices. A quick and wholesome meal.
preCookingProcess: Wash and soak rice for 20 minutes
Chop vegetables and slice onions
cookingProcess: Sauté spices and onions in ghee
Add vegetables and cook for 5 minutes
Add rice and water, cook until done
postCookingProcess: Fluff rice and let it rest for 5 minutes
Serve hot with raita or pickle
tipsAndTricks: Use aged basmati rice for better texture
Add a few drops of lemon juice to keep rice grains separate

name: Tofu Stir-Fry Quinoa Bowl
description: A wholesome, protein-rich vegetarian dinner featuring grilled tofu, quinoa, and colorful stir-fried vegetables. Ideal for post-workout recovery and lean muscle support.
preCookingProcess: Press tofu to remove excess water and cut into cubes
Rinse and cook quinoa until fluffy
Chop bell peppers and broccoli into bite-sized pieces
cookingProcess: Sauté tofu in olive oil until golden and crisp
Stir-fry vegetables in the same pan with soy sauce
Combine quinoa, tofu, and veggies in a bowl
postCookingProcess: Garnish with sesame seeds or lemon juice
Serve warm with a side of yogurt or hummus
tipsAndTricks: Use extra-firm tofu for better texture
Add spinach or edamame for extra protein boost

name: Paneer Roll
description: A popular Indian street food wrap made with spiced paneer cubes, sautéed veggies, and tangy chutneys rolled in a flaky paratha.
preCookingProcess: Cut paneer into strips and marinate with spices
Slice onions and capsicum
Prepare mint chutney or use store-bought
cookingProcess: Sauté paneer and veggies until golden
Warm parathas on tawa
Spread chutney, add filling, and roll tightly
postCookingProcess: Wrap in foil or parchment for easy handling
Serve hot with ketchup or yogurt dip
tipsAndTricks: Use whole wheat paratha for healthier version
Add lemon juice for extra zing

name: Masala Dosa
description: A crispy fermented rice-lentil crepe filled with spiced potato filling. A South Indian breakfast classic.
preCookingProcess: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 6 hours
Grind and ferment batter overnight
Boil and mash potatoes
Slice onions and prepare tempering ingredients
cookingProcess: Prepare potato filling with mustard seeds, onions, turmeric, and curry leaves
Heat dosa pan and spread batter thinly
Cook until crisp and place filling in center
Fold and serve hot
postCookingProcess: Serve with coconut chutney and sambar
Optional: drizzle ghee for extra flavor
tipsAndTricks: Fermentation time depends on climate—keep in warm place
Use cast iron pan for crispier dosa

name: Healthy Burger
description: A high-protein, low-calorie burger made with lean chicken, whole wheat buns, and fresh veggies. Perfect for fitness-focused meals.
preCookingProcess: Mix ground chicken with salt, pepper, and garlic powder
Shape into patties and chill for 10 minutes
Slice tomato and wash lettuce
cookingProcess: Grill or pan-fry patties until golden and cooked through
Toast buns lightly
Assemble burger with lettuce, tomato, patty, cheese, and yogurt sauce
postCookingProcess: Serve immediately with a side of salad or baked sweet potato fries
tipsAndTricks: Use Greek yogurt instead of mayo for lower fat
Add spinach or avocado for extra nutrients

name: Grilled Chicken Quinoa Bowl
description: A balanced dinner bowl with grilled chicken breast, quinoa, and sautéed vegetables. Ideal for post-workout recovery and lean muscle building.
preCookingProcess: Marinate chicken with garlic, lemon, and herbs
Rinse and boil quinoa until fluffy
Chop vegetables for sautéing
cookingProcess: Grill chicken until cooked through
Sauté vegetables in olive oil
Assemble bowl with quinoa, veggies, and sliced chicken
postCookingProcess: Drizzle lemon juice or yogurt dressing
Serve warm or chilled
tipsAndTricks: Use Greek yogurt dressing for extra protein
Add boiled eggs or tofu for variety

name: Fish Curry
description: A tangy and spicy coastal-style fish curry made with tamarind, coconut, and aromatic spices.
preCookingProcess: Clean and cut fish into pieces
Soak tamarind in warm water
Slice onions and prepare spice mix
cookingProcess: Sauté onions and spices until golden
Add tamarind water and coconut milk
Add fish and simmer for 15 minutes
postCookingProcess: Garnish with coriander
Serve hot with steamed rice
tipsAndTricks: Use firm fish to avoid breaking during cooking
Don’t overcook fish—it becomes rubbery

name: Indian Chicken Tacos
description: Fusion-style tacos with spiced chicken, mint chutney, and raita wrapped in soft rotis or tortillas. A bold Indian twist on a Mexican classic.
preCookingProcess: Marinate chicken with Indian spices
Prepare mint chutney and raita
Slice onions and warm rotis
cookingProcess: Cook chicken until browned and tender
Spread chutney and raita on rotis
Add chicken and garnish with onions
postCookingProcess: Fold tacos and serve immediately
Optional: grill lightly for crisp texture
tipsAndTricks: Use chicken seekh kebab mix for deeper flavor
Add shredded lettuce or cabbage for crunch

name: High-Protein Chicken Rice
description: A quick and nutritious post-workout meal combining lean chicken breast, brown rice, and veggies. Ideal for muscle recovery.
preCookingProcess: Boil brown rice until tender
Cut chicken into cubes and season with salt and pepper
Chop broccoli and mince garlic
cookingProcess: Sauté garlic in olive oil
Add chicken and cook until browned
Add broccoli and stir-fry for 5 minutes
Mix with cooked rice and stir well
postCookingProcess: Serve hot with lemon wedge or chili flakes
Store leftovers in airtight container for meal prep
tipsAndTricks: Use grilled chicken for extra flavor
Add bell peppers or spinach for variety

name: Aloo Paratha
description: Stuffed Indian flatbread with spiced mashed potatoes, pan-fried until golden. A hearty breakfast dish.
preCookingProcess: Boil and mash potatoes
Prepare dough with wheat flour and water
Mix mashed potatoes with spices and herbs
cookingProcess: Roll dough and stuff with potato mixture
Seal and roll into flat circles
Cook on tawa with ghee until golden brown
postCookingProcess: Serve hot with curd and pickle
Optional: add butter on top
tipsAndTricks: Use warm water for softer dough
Mash potatoes finely to avoid tearing while rolling

name: Butter Chicken
description: Creamy and mildly spiced chicken curry made with tomato gravy and butter. A North Indian favorite.
preCookingProcess: Marinate chicken with yogurt, chili powder, and garam masala for 30 minutes
Chop tomatoes and prepare ginger-garlic paste
cookingProcess: Cook marinated chicken until half done
Prepare tomato gravy with butter and spices
Add chicken and simmer until fully cooked
Finish with cream and kasuri methi
postCookingProcess: Garnish with coriander and drizzle cream
Serve hot with naan or rice
tipsAndTricks: Use fresh cream for richer taste
Grill chicken slightly before adding to gravy
